Blog.post: There is comfort in the knowledge you are of your kind and species that your deeds be not forgotten when your flesh has joined your forbears who have held this land before you and returned to earth, and rotted, in their time and in their season but yet live in you and through you. You will die, not like the sparrow unregarded, unconsidered, in the dark beyond the chamber, people's names are known, remembered, if they dare to live when living. Your wide actions build tomorrow that your children see without you every deed that's well accomplished lives beyond you, and each sapling that you plant and tend and care for casts its shade into that future that you neither fear nor enter. All will die, decay and perish and the world will perish with it. In the scale of rocks and oceans you are living in an eyeblink. In the scale of stars and planets life itself too fast to measure flickering green upon the surface. All the gods and stars will perish entropy alone will triumph in cold victory-feasts of stillness. This is comfort: face it bravely. Your significance, your measure but the scale of your perspective and the way you live while living. That you are a fleeting dust mote is a truth you can encompass and go on, each breath accomplished in the joy of human living till you die and each breath choosing life, and time for love and caring, unimportant and a hero both together, faring forward free of fate, in choice, becoming what you will, your destination. ~Jo Walton

I suppose that I should think about the other friends in my life. I know that they value who I am and I think that some of them will always be with me. I know that my heart will always be with them. I guess that I am just sad and there is nothing to doubt or sort out with them. And I do not think that there is anything much to figure out. Lisa has been a friend for decades and will always be there. Karen and I survived the crucible of MIT, things like that bond you forever. Byron is the kindest man that I have ever known and I am honored to be part of his life. Though, do not get me wrong, I see him as real and human. But, there is such kindness in him. And intelligence and insight. The years that we had together were the best in my life, no question. Lynn is a nut and I love her pragmatism and humor. Norm is great when she has time in her life for me. Same with Chris and Barb. Every connection with them is life only seconds have passed since the last hello. They are simply family. There has never been a place in my life where I did not find good people to spend time with, so I know that I can take any new job and it will be fine. And I know that my life will reshape into something that is OK. I guess that I do wish that I could fashion a life where some of these people were still in it day by day. But life seems to have ideas of its own.

Funny what they said about some hearts never healing. I always felt that some of the risks that I was taking were too dangerous. That there were some things from which I would never recover. Sometimes these days I cannot even grasp an image of what my heart shape was, hard to repair something when you have lost the plans. And I really do not have the heart to even bother. I just *know* that I will never want to try somethings again. Maybe that is what I have learned...that some things are not meant for me. I do not think that anyone save him could have taught me that. He certainly knew me better than anyone...so if he never even wanted to talk to me again, then what I am doing any of this for afterall? David was a child's heart of euphoria. Dean a logical choice or at least a choice of compromise. Stephen was and remains love, but a love that needs to be away for now. And maybe forever, but I know that he is always with me. And, at every cross-roads, I reach out in my heart or in reality, and he is there. Wanting me to be happy, wanting to understand my choices and somewhere deep inside wishing for those two lives or wishing that life will leave me his at some distant other time. But, Charlie, I thought was this soul-deep connection, a safe harbor where I would always be understood, always be loved, always be wanted in his life. I had no doubts about that and had this notion of sharing a duplex perhaps and living separate, but parallel lives. I struggled with the idea of whether or not I wanted that. I was afraid to trust him, with our past. And I knew that in some ways it would be a very cold friendship. I knew that he cared about me, but also knew that demonstrating that caring was hard and that somehow it seemed that he needed to always spend a little more time and money on himself than on me. But, still we had a strong connection and I decided that it was one that I could consider honoring. And Boulder had felt like home when I had been there before. So, off I went. Yet the first 30 seconds together seemed to crystalize for me that I was wrong in many of my assumptions, though most of these assumptions had been tested and discussed with him. But, that the distance that I sometimes felt was real and I could see at a glance that he did not really love me and no intention of trying. I suppose that I should have left then, but something said that I needed to stay and help him sort out his apartment some. I figured that I was just in a unique position to help. And, I think if I had left we would have remained better friends and I would have continued on. But having stayed and heard what he had to say about me to others ground the last vestigages of confidence and doubt out of my soul. The assumptions to make seemed the only ones left. And they were not pretty or easy. But, I suppose that life just is neither or those things.

Cool show at the Houston Museum of Fine Arts: The Heroic Century: The Museum of Modern Art's Masterpieces, 207 Paintings and Sculptures The Heroic Century presents more than 200 works that together provide a lucid overview of modern art since 1880, as represented by MoMA's unparalleled collection of painting and sculpture. The closure of the permanent collection galleries during construction of the Museum's new building has enabled the inclusion of a number of works that seldom travel but are nonetheless internationally known as canonical milestones in the development of modern art. Major examples include Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Pablo Picasso's Girl Before a Mirror, Jackson Pollock's Number 1, 1948, Roy Lichtenstein's Drowning Girl, Claude Monet´s Water Lilies, Salvador Dali´s The Persistence of Memory, and Jasper Johns's Green Target. The exhibition is accompanied by a fully illustrated catalogue containing an anthology of texts drawn from the Museum's archives and publications dating from 1929 to 2002. Museum of Fine Arts, Houston Houston, Texas September 21, 2003-January 4, 2004 Might have to go check it out.

Reminded me of being 12 and Mom commenting that I should always wear make-up. My skin is OK, but somehow the rest just makes a strong statement. We shall see. It is quiet, but peaceful. It feels good to be at a place in my life where no one is judging me and finding me lacking. Just people that care about me, ask after me, find the time to check on me. It centers me and makes it possible for me to think of the future. Of course, it is likely a future with none of them. But, I guess that it reminds me that there is some worth in me and that I can survive. And I hope to carry them with me as well. Read more on Botswana tonight, though only a little bit. Yawn. Funny how I feel. Hard to put into words really. I am tired. Took a couple hour nap and still tired. Mir napped with me. He is sweet. I need to pack more. And eat, I guess. Not sure why. Later...
So, goodbye.

OK. Horoscope said to leave him alone. So, screw it. He has not called me in two weeks, so well fine. No matter what he says when I call, obviously he does not want to talk to me. I think that he must not *really* have cared. And I never wanted to be someone that he could talk about like he talked about other people from the past...people that cling to him, or want other things from him, or were just somehow a burden. Screw that. He knows how to use the phone. And he knows how to email...well, he did once. And I am really tired of getting only things that he copies to her too. I mean it is one thing to move on, but I think that he moved on before he left. And if she means that much more to him, why did he ever claim to love me or want something from me? Though screw it, it does not matter, he wants nothing now, *that* much is clear. I am a good person, even if he cannot value that. I am fine alone. I can make more of a difference in the world that way anyway. So, that is what I will do.

Sigh. I wish sometimes that I did not care about people. But then I would not be me. Tomorrow should be fun. Fancy eats, etc. Of course, I am not hungry much lately...not for years really. Sunday, Secondhand Lions. MWF shots. TWRF SAT.
Oh, well, perhaps the first impression was correct, he never has called since CO.
I dunno. I told him to think about what he wanted. And he actually talked to me some.
Called him. Probably not a great idea. He just makes me feel rejected.
Back. Short trip, though perhaps fruitful. Mir, at least, is happy to see me.
OK, laundry pretty much ready. Sad to leave Mir again so soon, but I do need to keep him in kibble as it were. So, on the road once more...
Bored, waiting for laundry to dry so that I can pack. Need to get on the road soon.
A week passed now. Odd about life and time. Sometimes so slow, somtimes so fast. Sometimes both at the same time.

It is strange as more time passes, I wonder if I knew him at all. Odd. I really thoroughly trusted him. I wonder. It begins to seem like I will never know. I will shortly leave here and lose my email, etc. But, life continues. And there are people that love me. I will survive. I will never have intimacy, but that is OK too.

Of course, now that it is just me I am not sure what to say. I am tired. And sad. No, not really sad. It is not something about being sad. It is more about being disillusioned. And while in the past I might have fallen down the rabbit hole of why am I unworthy or what did I do wrong or why did I misjudge him and his emotions. That is not how I feel. I know that I am worthy. Few people, if any, could love him more or accept the reality of him as freely. And I was just me. And he never took the time to know me or my reactions. How can I feel rejected personally when he never understood how I felt? He did not take the time to know me personally. And I was thoughtful and tried to be open about what he was feeling. I asked questions, forced some discussion. I guess that what I am saying is that bottom-line...I tried. I gave it my heart. I gave it my mind. And very nearly my soul. And that is OK. It was my choice, explicitly considered. He was not what or who I thought. And the thing that lingers is wondering why I did not see him more clearly. Surely there were things that I did see. And benefits of the doubt granted at nearly every turn. But, I really never thought that Terri meant more to him than I did...but she does. As does his mom. And the cats. And Anil. In the end, I really meant almost nothing. I think that The Line meant more. And there was such manipulation. I always have said that if I could not proceed with the assumption that everything was well-meant. If I could not be accepting and open about relationships, then I would not have them. And I wonder if I should change or stop. I mean, I never seem to be what anyone wants in a relationship. Not a love relationship. Friendship is fine and good and easy. Love another kettle of fish completely. And while my relationships have not been "bad"...I can honestly say that my life has been the poorer since I let that aspect of life into my existence. Sex seems to me to be a thing of fleeting pleasure and enduring pain. Pain might be too strong, perhaps loss. Stephen commented yesterday that I was nicer to him than he deserved. It surprised me. I am not nice with any effort. I am just me. And he is easy to be nice to really. Not an effort. I wonder if it was an effort at some point. And while I do not want to really see him daily or engage him daily, since he is tethered to other people, his family. I love him and always will. And since I know that he loves me and sees me as a truly special woman, then loving him and interacting "nicely" is no effort. I am not sure where I was going there. Perhaps one reflection is that I can see how his life is better for knowing me. I am surely one reason that he knows his kids, remains with his family. Is capable of loving another. Has much higher self-esteem. Knows what it is to be loved. I know that too, for I know that he loves me. But I wonder if that makes me stronger. I am not sure. I remember days that I regretted knowing what it meant to be loved. Since it also meant understanding about loss. Loss is an issue. Though sometimes I wonder if you ever really have. So, is loss just the death of illusions. Why mourn something that never was?
OK, converted to just me here. Made the book blog for Barb and Chris. And the Ex-Celanese blog.

I had thought that over time my relationships were getting better, more intelligent, stronger emotionally. But, this moment is the worst ever.
